title: 1943–44 in Mandatory Palestine football
text:
The 1943–44 season was the 17th season of competitive <a href="Association%20football">football</a> in the <a href="Mandatory%20Palestine">British Mandate for Palestine</a> under the <a href="Israeli%20Football%20Association">Eretz Israel Football Association</a>.
IFA Competitions.
1941–42 Palestine League.
League matches, which started during the <a href="1941%E2%80%9342%20in%20Mandatory%20Palestine%20football">previous season</a> were completed during the season with a single match played in the southern division and the final round play-offs. <a href="Maccabi%20Rishon%20LeZion%20F.C.">Maccabi Rishon LeZion</a> won the southern division and qualified to the playoffs, along with second placed <a href="Maccabi%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Maccabi Tel Aviv</a> and Jerusalem division winner, <a href="Homenetmen">Homenetmen Jerusalem</a>. In the play-offs, Maccabi Tel Aviv won both its matches against Maccabi Rishon LeZion, while Homenetmen withdrew after playing one match, forfeiting the rest of its fixtures, and Maccabi Tel Aviv was declared league champions.
1943–44 Palestine League.
League matches began on 11 September 1943 However, the league matches were not completed by the end of the season, and were continued after the summer break.
1943 Palestine Cup.
A cup competition was held during the <a href="1942%E2%80%9343%20in%20Mandatory%20Palestine%20football">previous season</a>, in spring 1943, which was called The Wartime Cup, with the semi-finals and final being delayed over the summer break. The final, between <a href="Hapoel%20Jerusalem%20F.C.">Hapoel Jerusalem</a> and a <a href="Royal%20Artillery">Royal Artillery</a> XI was played on 16 October 1943, with the Gunners winning 7–1.
1944 Palestine Cup.
The competition started on 19 February 1944, but was delayed over the summer break and were completed during the <a href="1944%E2%80%9345%20in%20Mandatory%20Palestine%20football">following season</a>.
